qas.question: How many incorporated cities are in Oklahoma?
How many Oklahoma cities have over 100,000 people?
How many of the 50 largest US cities are in Oklahoma?
What is the largest metro area in Oklahoma as of 2010?
How many people live in the Tulsa metro area?

context: <a2_0>Oklahoma<a2_0/> had <a0_0>598<a0_0/> incorporated places in 2010, including <a1_0>four<a1_0/> cities over 100,000 in population and 43 over 10,000. Two of the fifty largest cities in the United States are located in Oklahoma, Oklahoma City and Tulsa, and 65 percent of Oklahomans live within their metropolitan areas, or spheres of economic and social influence defined by the United States Census Bureau as a metropolitan statistical area. <a3_0>Oklahoma City<a3_0/>, the state's capital and largest city, had the largest metropolitan area in the state in 2010, with 1,252,987 people, and the metropolitan area of Tulsa had <a4_0>937,478<a4_0/> residents. Between 2000 and 2010, the cities that led the state in population growth were Blanchard (172.4%), Elgin (78.2%), Jenks (77.0%), Piedmont (56.7%), Bixby (56.6%), and Owasso (56.3%).
